question.title: How to programmatically (in Java, not XML) configure JDBC connection pool in Tomcat?
question.body:
here is a simple app that starts Tomcat from code:

public class TestStarter {

    public static void main(String[] args) throws LifecycleException {
        Tomcat tomcat = new Tomcat();
        tomcat.setPort(8080);
        tomcat.getConnector();

        String contextPath = "";
        String docBase = new File(".").getAbsolutePath();

        Context context = tomcat.addContext(contextPath, docBase);

        String servletName = "HelloServlet";
        tomcat.addServlet(contextPath, servletName, new HelloServlet());
        context.addServletMappingDecoded("/test", servletName);

        tomcat.start();
        tomcat.getServer().await();
    }
}

Let's say I want to use a JDBC connection in the servlets and get a connection from the JDBC pool. How to do this?
